intro: Manulea rhodantha subsp. rhodantha, commonly known as the red-flowered manulea, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its botanical features make it an attractive species for botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
